alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:05PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MARENGO...GREENE... WESTERN HALE AND SUMTER COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CST... At 1104 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Gainesville to Boyd to near Alamucha. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Livingston, Eutaw, York, Linden, Cuba, Jefferson, Moundville, Forkland, Akron, Boligee, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, Dayton, Thornhill, Boyd, Sawyerville, Coatopa, and Kinterbish. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for west central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southwestern and west central Alabama.
